titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies, Yale University, Exhibit and Research Materials from The Pink and The Blue
Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies, Yale University, Exhibit and Research Materials from The Pink and The Blue
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera and Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:37

did.unittitle: Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies, Yale University, exhibit and research materials from The Pink and The Blue

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of research files and exhibit panels relating to The Pink and the Blue: Lesbian and Gay Life at Yale and in Connecticut, 1642-2004 , an exhibit produced by the Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies at Yale. The research files consist primarily of duplicated material, however, some original writings, photographs, and memorabilia documenting Yale's lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community are also included.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 14-B (YRG 14-B), Records of academic departments and programs of the Yale Faculty of Arts and Sciences.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies Coordinator, 2004. Additional donor information provided at the file level.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies, Yale University, Exhibit and Research Materials from The Pink and The Blue (RU 963). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by subject and material type.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies at Yale was founded in 2002 with a gift by Arthur Kramer in honor of his brother, author and activist Larry Kramer. The initiative supports the lesbian and gay community at Yale University through academic programs including lectures, conferences and symposia, special events, and community building activities.

In 2004, the Larry Kramer Initiative produced a major exhibition, The Pink and the Blue: Lesbian and Gay Life at Yale and in Connecticut, 1642-2004 . In addition to conducting research, the Initiative staff solicited and received donations of material related to Yale's lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender history from Yale alumni and staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of research files and exhibit panels relating to The Pink and the Blue: Lesbian and Gay Life at Yale and in Connecticut, 1642-2004 , an exhibit produced by the Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies at Yale. The research files consist primarily of duplicated material, however, some original writings, photographs, and memorabilia documenting Yale's lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community are also included.

controlaccess.subject: Exhibitions
Gay and lesbian studies

Homosexuality and education
Lesbians -- Connecticut -- History

controlaccess.corpname: Yale University. Larry Kramer Initiative for Lesbian and Gay Studies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The research files consist of bibliographical references, copies from articles, books and manuscripts, research notes, correspondence, manuscripts and memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The research files are arranged in rough chronological order.

scopecontent.p: Includes a short historical sketch by J. D. McClatchy of the 1973 seminar, the Literature of Ambiguity.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contact Public Services (phone: 203 432-1735, e-mail: mssa.reference@yale.edu) for information on accessing this digital object.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes newpaper and article clippings, and flyers for events sponsored by the Larry Kramer Initiative.
